titleStmt.title: Description of Free Library of Philadelphia, Lewis E 114: Book of Hours, Use of Rome

msIdentifier.collection: John Frederick Lewis Collection of European Manuscripts

msContents.summary: This is a mid-fifteenth-century Book of Hours, use of Rome.

msItem.title: Book of Hours, Use of Rome

respStmt.persName: Follower of the master of the vitae imperatorum

supportDesc.extent: 104+ii; 119 x 87 mm bound to 126 x 90 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Modern foliation in pencil, upper corner recto

p.catchwords: Horizontal center of lower margin verso; fols. 8, 16, 24, 32, 40, 48, 58, 66, 74, 82, 90, 98

layoutDesc.layout: Frame-ruled in ink, every line ruled, fifteen lines in one column; written area: 78 x 54 mm

decoDesc.decoNote: One- and two-line initials in red and blue with foliate and geometric designs throughout, twelve historiated initials, miniature of the Annunciation and a foliated border (fol. 1r)
18vHistoriated three line illuminated initial D, Saint John the Baptist
21vInhabited three line illuminated initial D, Saint holding quill; same as fol. 34v
24vInhabited three line illuminated initial D, Saint holding quill
27rInhabited three line illuminated initial D, Saint
29vInhabited three line illuminated initial D, Saint holding red cross
34vInhabited three line illuminated initial C, Saint holding quill; same as fol. 21v
51rInhabited three line illuminated initial D, Saint wearing crown
61rInhabited three line illuminated initial R, saint wearing mitre
69vInhabited three line illuminated initial D, skull
98rInhabited four line illuminated initial D; gold cross on Calvary
101rFour line inhabited initial D; dove with Trinity

binding.p: Early nineteenth-century mottled vellum; stamped in gold on spine, "offices de vierge" and "avec miniature"; edges speckled with red

history.provenance: Bought at Verona, May 1698, by Louis Bourguet; John Frederick Lewis, Philadelphia; given by his widow, Anne Baker Lewis, to the Free Library of Philadelphia in 1936
